qas.question: What fraction of land was under cultivation using the two-field system?
What fraction of land was under cultivate using the three-field system?
What invention allowed horses rather than oxen to be used to plow?
What invention led to an increase in efficiency in the farming of heavy soils?
In addition to requiring less pasture, what distinguishes horses from oxen?

context: The development of a three-field rotation system for planting crops[AA] increased the usage of land from <a0_0>one half<a0_0/> in use each year under the old two-field system to <a1_0>two-thirds<a1_0/> under the new system, with a consequent increase in production. The development of <a3_0>the heavy plough<a3_0/> allowed heavier soils to be farmed more efficiently, aided by the spread of <a2_0>the horse collar<a2_0/>, which led to the use of draught horses in place of oxen. Horses are <a4_0>faster<a4_0/> than oxen and require less pasture, factors that aided the implementation of the three-field system.
